revised_title: Homi Bhabha: A Life Dedicated to Science and Patriotism
tldr: This book review by Sir Arnold Wolfendale and Sir Alan Cook discusses G. Venkataraman's "Bhabha and Magnificent Obsession," which chronicles the life and work of Indian scientist Homi Bhabha. The book covers Bhabha's early work in Cambridge, his establishment of the Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR) in Bombay, and his contributions to nuclear energy in India. The authors highlight Bhabha's dedication to science and patriotism, as well as his influence on Indian science and technology.
